# Build a Game

> **来源**: https://dev.epicgames.com/documentation/en-us/fortnite/build-a-game-in-unreal-editor-for-fortnite
> **爬取时间**: 2025-12-26T22:53:11.289165

---

Each tutorial provides step-by-step guidance on how to use **Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN)** and **Verse** to create a [project](https://dev.epicgames.com/documentation/en-us/fortnite/unreal-editor-for-fortnite-glossary#project) that results in a complete island experience.

Each one explores the mechanics for a specific game mode, and shows you how to combine and modify various [assets](https://dev.epicgames.com/documentation/en-us/fortnite/unreal-editor-for-fortnite-glossary#asset) directly in UEFN.

From UEFN, you can [playtest](https://dev.epicgames.com/documentation/en-us/fortnite/unreal-editor-for-fortnite-glossary#playtest) your project directly in a Creative [client](https://dev.epicgames.com/documentation/en-us/fortnite/unreal-editor-for-fortnite-glossary#client), and [live edit](https://dev.epicgames.com/documentation/en-us/fortnite/unreal-editor-for-fortnite-glossary#edit-mode) as you go.

Accessibility starts at the design phase. To avoid creating content that can lead to a photosensitive reaction, please use the following guidelines:

- Ensure that no component of any content flashes more than three times in any 1-second interval. This is no more than 6 transitions from light to dark or dark to light in a 1-second interval.
- Keep any flashing areas small; generally to an area less than 25% of 10 degrees of visual field. A 10 degree visual field on a 1024 X 768 display that is 15-17 inches diagonally and viewed at 22-26 inches away is 341 X 256 pixels. Thus, the combined area of flashes occurring concurrently should occupy no more than a total of one quarter of any 341 X 256 pixel rectangles anywhere on the displayed screen area when the content is viewed at 1024 x 768 pixels.
- Measure the flashes, strobing, or pulsing sections using online tools.
